result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lawanda Denise Ray

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on November 23, 2022 at 11:30 am.
PH rescheduled while in court; notice of new date provided.

Defendant Lawanda Denise Ray in court.  Attorney Edgar A Beltran in court for Lawanda Denise Ray.  Prosecuting attorney Jeanette Kara Corbett in court for the State of Wisconsin. Def req preliminary hearing.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on November 21, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Per req of counsel, no objection from State and consent of Court, HE set 10-20-22 at 9:45am rescheduled to 10-27-22 at 8:15am due to calendar conflict of counsel; notice sent.

Defendant Lawanda Denise Ray in court.  Attorney Edgar A Beltran in court for Lawanda Denise Ray.  Prosecuting attorney Mark David Bensen in court for the State of Wisconsin. Counsel's first appearance. Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing.
Hearing scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Absolute sobriety. Not possess/use any controlled substance without valid prescription.

Prosecuting attorney Mark David Bensen in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Lawanda Denise Ray appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Edgar A Beltran in court for Lawanda Denise Ray. Def consents to appearing by video.  Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found. Court informs Defendant of DNA expungement rights. SPD to appoint.  Court sets $1000 signature bond.  Def waives time limits on preliminary hearing; Court accepts.  Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing.
Hearing scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
